column4: can I get a VNC session from a computer without a graphics card?
definately possible
Link?
http://google.com/search?q=Xvnc , try that
I tried to install and run x11vnc, but it did not work.
what do you mean by it did not work?
did it give any error messages?
x11vnc is a vnc server for a running X display, you need Xvnc
I'll try Xvnc.
there is no Xvnc package.
try sudo apt-get install vncserver
how about vnc4server?
that should be fine
I cannot connect still (I ran vncserver then went into Applications>>Internet>>Terminal Server Client)
are you making sure to set the type to VNC in Terminal Server Client?
yes.
when you run vncserver do you get any error messages?
(on host) It asked me for my password, gave me the location of the startup script, ran the programs in the startup folder and gave me the location of my log file(s).
im not sure what the problem is then sorry
the error is "Connections refused(111)" - on client.
you need to figure out what port it is listening on probably
it connected, but I cannot enter anything into the input field.
is gnome installed on the machine?
